Intervals#

An interval is an uncertain number for which only the endpoints are known, \(x=[a,b]\). This is interpreted as $x$ being between \(a\) and \(b\) but with no more information about the value of \(x\). Intervals embody epistemic uncertainty within PBA.

Intervals can be created using:

import pba
pba.Interval(0,1)
pba.I(0,1)

Class Documentation#

class pba.interval.Interval(left=None, right=None)#

Parameters: - left : numeric

left side of interval

  • rightnumeric

    right side of interval

equiv(other)#

Checks whether two intervals are equivalent. True if self.left == other.right and self.right == other.right

hi()#

Returns the right side of the interval

intersection(other)#

Calculates the intersection between two intervals

lo()#

Returns the left side of the interval

midpoint()#

Returns midpoint of interval (self.left+self.right)/2

oadd(other)#

Returns addition using opposite arithmetic

a+b = [a.left + b.right, a.right + b.left]

odiv(other)#

Returns division using opposite arithmetic

a/b = [a.left / b.right, a.right / b.left]

omul(other)#

Returns multiplication using opposite arithmetic

a*b = [a.left * b.right, a.right * b.left]

osub(other)#

Returns subtraction using opposite arithmetic

a+b = [a.left - b.right, a.right - b.left]

padd(other)#

Returns addition using perfect arithmetic

a+b = [a.left + b.left, a.right + b.right]

pdiv(other)#

Returns division using opposite arithmetic

a/b = [a.left / b.left, a.right / b.right]

pmul(other)#

Returns multiplication using opposite arithmetic

a*b = [a.left * b.left, a.right * b.right]

psub(other)#

Returns subtraction using perfect arithmetic

a+b = [a.left - b.left, a.right - b.right]

recip()#

Calculates the reciprocle of the interval. If \(0 \in [a,b]\) it returns a division by zero error

sample(seed=None) → float#

Returns a random value from within the interval

straddles(N, endpoints=True)#

Parameters#

Nnumeric

Number to check

endpointsbool

Whether to include the endpoints within the check

Returns#

True

If \(\mathrm{left} \leq N \leq \mathrm{right}\) (Assuming endpoints=True)

False

Otherwise

straddles_zero(endpoints=True)#

Checks whether \(0\) is within the interval

to_logical()#

Turns the interval into a logical interval, this is done by chacking the truth value of the ends of the interval

width()#

Returns the width of the interval self.right - self.left
